questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site is known for its Renaissance architecture and hosts the famous 15th-century painting, 'The Last Supper'?
questions.context: This site in Italy is world-renowned for Leonardo da Vinci's mural, painted directly on the church's wall, depicting Jesus and the Apostles.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel located in the United Arab Emirates features a sail-like design and stands on an artificial island?
questions.context: This luxury hotel, often voted as a top icon of modern architecture, started welcoming guests in December 1999 and is famous for its helipad.

questions.question: Which city is home to the famous historical battle site known as the location of Napoleon's final defeat in 1815?
questions.context: This battle site marks the end of Napoleon Bonaparte's rule as Emperor of the French and is located just south of Brussels.

questions.question: Which world-famous museum located in Paris is home to the Mona Lisa and resides in a former royal palace?
questions.context: Known for housing various masterpieces, this museum is the largest art museum in the world and a historic monument of France.

questions.question: What ancient ruin in the heart of Cairo is the last remaining wonder of the original Seven Wonders of the Ancient World?
questions.context: This colossal limestone structure was originally built as a tomb for the Pharaoh Khufu around 2560 BC and remains an icon of Egypt.
